intro: Santiria rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated santiria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with a narrow, elongated tip. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture. Santiria rostrata is valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
